data.title: 15 MAJOR songs that never actually reached Number 1
data.meta_description: A look at some of the songs which famously reached Number 2 on the charts - by artists including Destiny's Child, Justin Timberlake and Calvin Harris
data.text:
So many big hits!

Sometimes, despite a song being a HUGE hit, it is still narrowly pipped to the top spot of the charts. Even much-loved songs by some of the world's biggest and best artists are often found in the Number 2 position.

If you love your nostalgia, then you’ll love KISSTORY All Stars, which sees some of our fave stars, from the worlds of acting, sport, music and beyond look back at the music which shaped them.

To celebrate some of the best songs which reached Number 2, we've taken a look through some of our favourite tracks which just missed out on the top spot. Have a look through our list and enjoy huge hits from artists including Craig David, Calvin Harris and Destiny's Child. Some of them may surprise you...

‘Rise & Fall’ - Craig David featuring Sting

The song was released in April 2002 and featured on Craig’s second studio album ‘Slicker Than Your Average’, which was released in November 2002. ‘Rise & Fall’ was based on a sample of Sting’s song ‘Shape of My Heart’, from the 1993 Sting album ‘Ten Summoner’s Tales’.

‘Rise & Fall’ reached Number 2 on the UK Singles Chart, whilst in Hungary, Romania and Poland it reached Number 1.

WATCH: Craig David - 'Rise & Fall' featuring Sting (Music Video)

‘Re-Rewind (The Crowd Say Bo Selecta)' - Artful Dodger featuring Craig David

Released in November 1999, the track saw Craig team up with garage duo Artful Dodger. The melody in the verses of the track was taken from a previous demo of Craig’s called Last Night.

‘Re-Rewind’ was the first record that was signed by the record label Relentless Records. The song reached Number 2 on the UK Singles Chart and is certified Platinum.

WATCH: Craig David - 'Re-Rewind - (The Crowd Say Bo Selecta)' (Official Audio)

‘Bounce’ - Calvin Harris featuring Kelis

Released in June 2011, ‘Bounce’ was the first single to be released from Calvin’s third studio album ‘18 Months’, which was released in October 2012.

The track topped the chart in Scotland, but reached Number 2 in the UK Singles Chart. It is certified Platinum in the UK.

WATCH: Calvin Harris - 'Bounce' featuring Kelis (Music Video)

‘Movin’ Too Fast’ - Artful Dodger featuring Romina Johnson

First released in July 1999, ‘Movin’ Too Fast’ features on Artful Dodger’s debut album ‘It’s All About The Stragglers’, which was released in 2000. The song was originally recorded as a solo track for Romina’s 1998 album ‘Simply Passion’.

When the collab was first released, it didn’t chart, but it was later re-released in February 2000 - which was when it got to Number 2 on the UK Singles Chart. It is certified Platinum.

WATCH: Artful Dodger - 'Movin' Too Fast' (Music Video)

‘One More Time' - Daft Punk

This single was released in November 2000 and featured on Daft Punk’s second album ‘Discovery’, which was released in March 2001. The song features vocals from Romanthony and a sample of Eddie Johns’ ‘More Spell on You.’

The song reached Number 2 in the UK, but topped the charts in Portugal, Canada and France. ‘One More Time’ is certified Platinum in the UK.

WATCH: Daft Punk - 'One More Time'

‘Feel So Close’ - Calvin Harris

The second single from ‘18 Months’, ‘Feel So Close’ was released in August 2011 and sees Calvin sing on the track. Topping the chart in Scotland, the song reached Number 2 on the UK Singles Chart and is certified 2x Platinum in the UK.

WATCH: Calvin Harris - 'Feel So Close' (Music Video)

‘How Deep Is Your Love’ - Calvin Harris with Disciples

The song was released in July 2015 and features vocals from Ina Wroldsen, which are uncredited. Reaching Number 2 on the UK Singles Chart, ‘How Deep Is Your Love’ hit the top spot of the chart in Australia, Belgium, Greece, the Netherlands and Russia.

It is certified 3x Platinum in the UK.

WATCH: Calvin Harris - 'How Deep Is Your Love' featuring Disciples (Music Video)

‘Bootylicious’ - Destiny's Child

Released in May 2001, ‘Bootylicious’ featured on Destiny’s Child’s third studio album ‘Survivor’, which was released in April 2001, the track was the second song to be released from the album. The song reached the top of the Billboard Charts in the US, but reached Number 2 on the UK Singles Chart. It is certified Platinum in the UK.

WATCH: Destiny's Child - 'Bootylicious' (Music Video)

‘Lose My Breath' - Destiny's Child

‘Lose My Breath’ was released in September 2004 and is from the fifth and final of Destiny’s Child’s albums, called ‘Destiny Fulfilled’, which was released in November 2004. The song was nominated for a Grammy Award for Best R & B Vocal Performance by a Duo or Group. The track reached Number 2 on the UK Singles Chart and is certified Platinum.

WATCH: Destiny's Child - 'Lose My Breath' (Music Video)

‘This Is What You Came For’ - Calvin Harris featuring Rihanna

Calvin teamed up with Rihanna on ‘This Is What You Came For’, which was released in April 2016. Calvin wrote the song with Taylor Swift, who used the pseudonym Nils Sjoberg. It also includes uncredited backing vocals from Taylor. The song is certified 4x Platinum in the UK.

WATCH: Calvin Harris - 'This Is What You Came For' featuring Rihanna (Music Video)

‘We Be Burnin’ - Sean Paul

This track was released in August 2005 and is the first single from Sean Paul’s third studio album ‘The Trinity.’ The song reached Number 2 in the UK and is certified Silver.

WATCH: Sean Paul - 'We Be Burnin' (Music Video)

WARNING: This song contains drug references

‘Let’s Go’ - Calvin Harris featuring Ne-Yo

Released in March 2012 as the third single from ‘18 Months’. The song features vocals from Ne-Yo and reached Number 2 on the UK Singles Chart. ‘Let’s Go’ has been certified Platinum in the UK. The track is played when the Los Angeles Dodgers baseball team hit a home run.

WATCH: Calvin Harris - 'Let's Go' featuring Ne-Yo (Music Video)

‘She Doesn’t Mind’ - Sean Paul

‘She Doesn’t Mind’ was originally released in October 2011, with a remix released in March 2012 which features Pitbull. The song was the second single to be released from Sean’s fifth studio album ’Thomahawk Technique’, which was released in January 2012. Reaching Number 2 on the UK Singles Chart, the song is certified Platinum in the UK.

WATCH: Sean Paul - 'She Doesn't Mind' (Music Video)

‘Baby Boy’ - Beyoncé featuring Sean Paul

‘Baby Boy’ was released in August 2003 and features on Beyoncé's debut solo album ‘Dangerously In Love’, which was released in June 2003. The song topped the US Billboard Chart, remaining in the top spot for nine consecutive weeks. In the UK, the song reached Number 2 and is certified Platinum.

WATCH: Beyonce - 'Baby Boy' featuring Sean Paul (Music Video)

‘Pop Ya Collar’ - Usher

’Pop Ya Collar’ was released in October 2000, and was produced for Usher’s cancelled third studio album ‘All About U’, with the album later becoming abandoned after several tracks, including this one, were leaked. It later featured on his official third studio album ‘8701.’ It peaked at Number 2 on the UK Singles Chart and is certified Silver.

WATCH: Usher - 'Pop Ya Collar' (Music Video)
